intro: Hoya sigillatis subsp. paitanensis, commonly known as the Paitanensis Wax Plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apocynaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in regions of Thailand and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and waxy, ovate leaves that are often marked with distinctive patterns. It produces clusters of small, star-shaped flowers in shades of white and pink, which bloom during the summer months. This species is popular among indoor gardeners due to its low maintenance and attractive appearance.
